episode: I was furious when I took a lunch break during a 13 hour shift when I had gotten permission, and I was told I would penalized because of it.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I was furious when I took a break during a 13 hour shift, and then was told I would be penalized for it

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds incredibly unfair! Did they explain why?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Apparently I was in error because I didn't report to the right person. I missed a text while I was working and although I had reported to the same guy previously...this particular workday was cut up into 3 shifts for me and the one in the middle...before I took my break I had to check in for someone else.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That’s really frustrating. It sounds like a confusing setup.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: VERY. Honestly having been a supervisor in the past and considering the circumstances, if I were her I would have just let it pass because it was an honest mistake and I had gotten permission by our overall boss to do so.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's a pity they didn’t consider your past experience and the situation.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: They don't care. They are kind of shady and if I hadn't complained to senior staff by calling their headquarters the next day...I would have been punished by this low tier supervisor

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Glad you stood up for yourself and called HQ!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm an independent contractor and some people are fickle, cheap, or both and you have to be on your toes. I only work with decent clients.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's wise to choose clients carefully.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: You usually never know until you work for them once or twice

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It’s tough but learning from each experience helps.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh yes, i've gotten experience now where I know when to supercede micromanaging nonsense because I need to protect myself. If you don't complain, they'll kill you and say you liked it.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's crucial to stand up for yourself and set boundaries.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: People are so mean spirited these days. I just try to stay professional even if others don't. Needless to say...I was furious in the moment...so I walked off the job because I wasn't going to get penalized for the few hours we had still scheduled after working hard for more than half the time I was contracted for

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's understandable. Good for you standing firm.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: People will walk all over you. It's ok to be furious but defend yourself when dealing with nonsense

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Absolutely, standing up is key. Take care!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: thank you I like that you listened

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You're welcome. Always here to listen.
